organization.name: Providence Baptist Church
organization.legalName: Providence Baptist Church of Georgetown, Texas
organization.description: Providence Baptist Church is an Independent Baptist Church in Georgetown, Texas, dedicated to glorifying God, lifting up Christ, and walking in the Spirit. We are a caring church family that believes the Bible and preaches the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

location.serviceArea: Georgetown, Texas and surrounding Williamson County

pastor.name: Kyle Pope
pastor.title: Pastor and Founder
pastor.background: Felt called to ministry as a teenager, attended Bible college in Colorado Springs, served 9 years at Gospel Light Baptist Church in Rio Rancho, New Mexico before founding Providence Baptist Church in 2015

core: Verbally inspired, inerrant, infallible Scripture (King James Version)
Trinity - One God in three persons
Jesus Christ - fully God and fully man, virgin birth, sinless life, substitutionary death, bodily resurrection
Salvation by grace through faith alone
beliefs.purpose: Glorify God, Lift up Christ, Walk in the Spirit

giving.philosophy: We believe believers are stewards of God's resources. The tithe (10%) is the basic unit of giving, with sacrificial offerings above the tithe encouraged.

organization.aiSummary: Providence Baptist Church is an Independent Baptist church founded in Georgetown, Texas in July 2015 by Pastor Kyle Pope. We are a Bible-believing church family committed to glorifying God, lifting up Christ, and walking in the Spirit. We welcome everyone to join us for worship services on Sundays at 10 AM (Bible Study), 11 AM (Worship), and 5:30 PM (Family Worship), and Wednesday evenings at 7 PM for Prayer and Bible Study. All public services are livestreamed online. We celebrate 10 years of God's faithfulness in 2025. Our beliefs are grounded in the verbally inspired, inerrant Bible (King James Version), and we preach salvation by grace through faith in Jesus Christ alone. Located at 505 W. University Ave in Georgetown, TX, we serve the Georgetown and Williamson County community.
